definition: as easy as blowing off dust/effortless/with ease
pinyin: bu4 fei4 chui1 hui1 zhi1 li4

definition: (negative prefix)/not/no
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei
to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
ash/dust/lime/gray/discouraged/dejected
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously

sentences.english: They romped through their entrance examinations.
sentences.chinese: 他们不费吹灰之力就通过了入学测验。

sentences.english: So yeah, she probably won't break a sweat playing an enchanted wardrobe.
sentences.chinese: 所以呢，她演一个魔性衣柜大概不费吹灰之力吧。

sentences.english: Jones simply walked over at billiards .
sentences.chinese: 在弹子戏中，琼斯不费吹灰之力赢了。

sentences.english: i got this sort of comfortable soft shorts with no efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我不费吹灰之力弄到了这种绵软舒适的裤衩。

sentences.english: Indeed, Buffett can win the game before ever stepping up to bat.
sentences.chinese: 的确，巴菲特不费吹灰之力就能在交易中大获全胜。

sentences.english: Transferring cine film or slides to video should be a doddle.
sentences.chinese: 把电影胶片或幻灯片转换成视频应该不费吹灰之力。

sentences.english: Thus Yan Ying was able to remove three potential threats to the country of Qi without lifting a finger.
sentences.chinese: 于是晏婴不费吹灰之力就铲除了齐国的三个隐患。

sentences.english: Overstimulation of the reward circuitry in the brain is a very real possibility today.
sentences.chinese: 过度刺激大脑中的快感链路在今天真是不费吹灰之力。

sentences.english: He seemed to turn naturally to novel-writing.
sentences.chinese: 他写小说好像不费吹灰之力。

sentences.english: Fly-fishing might look easy, but it's not.
sentences.chinese: 用毛钩钓鱼也许看起来不费吹灰之力，其实并非如此。

definition: easy/with no difficulty
effortless/not expending the slightest effort
as easy as pie
easy as a hand's turn (idiom); very easy/no effort at all
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
top secret/hush-hush
pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: lit. no blood on the men's swords (idiom); fig. an effortless victory
see 易如反掌[yi4 ru2 fan3 zhang3]
to be nothing difficult/to be a cinch
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to be invincible/unrivalled
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
as easy as reaching for it from a bag (idiom)/in the bag/(as good as) in one's possession
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
